00:00:12:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:12:210000.Dialogue: I was going to get my mail.

00:00:14:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:14:190000.Dialogue: Okay. Are... are you hoping to get it telepathically?

00:00:25:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:25:080000.Dialogue: And no. I just wasn't sure of the proper protocol now that you and Leonard are no longer having coitus.

00:00:31:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:31:230000.Dialogue: God, can we please just say "no longer seeing each other"?

00:00:35:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:35:110000.Dialogue: Well, we could if it were true. But as you live in the same building, you see each other all the time. The variable which has changed is the coitus.

00:00:43:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:43:180000.Dialogue: Okay, here's the protocol: you and I are still friends, and you stop saying "coitus."

00:00:49:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:49:100000.Dialogue: Good, good. I'm glad we're still friends.

00:00:53:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:53:180000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. It was a lot of work to accommodate you in my life. I'd hate for that effort to have been in vain.

00:01:01:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:190000.Dialogue: Just to be clear, do I have to stop saying "coitus" with everyone or just you?

00:01:09:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:09:080000.Dialogue: Harsh terms. But all right-- I'll just substitute "intercourse."

00:01:14:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:14:110000.Dialogue: Or "fornication." Yeah. But that has judgmental overtones, so I'll hold that in reserve.

00:01:22:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:22:070000.Dialogue: Well, my existence is a continuum, so I've been what I am at each point in the implied time period.

00:01:31:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:31:070000.Dialogue: You're just coitusing with me, aren't you?

00:01:40:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:40:230000.Dialogue: He seems all right. Although he does spend a disturbing amount of time looking at photographs of you and smelling the pillow you slept on.

00:01:50:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:50:040000.Dialogue: Oh, but now that I think of it, he asked me not to tell you that.

00:01:54:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:54:190000.Dialogue: I'll pretend I didn't hear it.

00:01:57:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:57:010000.Dialogue: I'd rather you pretend I didn't say it.

00:02:01:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:01:000000.Dialogue: I see you bought Mama Italia marinara spaghetti sauce.

00:02:06:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:120000.Dialogue: That's the sauce my mother uses. She likes cooking Italian because according to her, that's what the Romans made Jesus eat.

00:02:14:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:14:170000.Dialogue: Interesting. I'll have to have you over for spaghetti some night.

00:02:20:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:20:040000.Dialogue: Oh. Um, okay. Why don't you give me an hour and come over?

00:02:25:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:25:010000.Dialogue: Will you cut up hot dogs into little chunks and mix them in with the sauce?

00:02:31:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:31:080000.Dialogue: Oh, it's all right; I do. Oh! You're in for what my mother calls "a real Eye-talian treat""

00:02:43:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:43:110000.Dialogue: What's wrong with you? You can't hang out with your roommate's ex. That's totally uncool.

00:02:48:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:48:210000.Dialogue: No, it's fine. I don't care. I'm over it.

00:02:52:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:52:160000.Dialogue: Yeah, he's over it; that's why he's been whining all day about trying to invent that memory-wiper gizmo from Men in Black.

00:02:58:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:58:170000.Dialogue: Is he making any progress? Because I'd like to erase Ben Affleck as Daredevil.

00:03:09:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:09:100000.Dialogue: The point is, in a situation like this you got to pick sides. You're either on Team Leonard or Team Penny.

00:03:20:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:20:040000.Dialogue: Well, usually I'm on the team that picks last.

00:03:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:23:160000.Dialogue: Unless there's a kid in a wheelchair.

00:03:28:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:28:180000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I got you your tangerine chicken. I hope you're hungry.

00:03:34:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:34:020000.Dialogue: Well, of course I'm hungry. And as I have no plans to eat with any other team, I will consume my tangerine chicken with the appropriate gusto. Mm, mm, mm!

00:03:47:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:190000.Dialogue: Just out of curiosity, do we still have hot dogs?

00:03:52:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:52:120000.Dialogue: Just making dinner conversation. Go, Team Leonard!

00:04:26:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:26:230000.Dialogue: Let me ask you a question. Do you believe you're going to go to hell for eating sweet and sour pork?

00:04:32:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:32:180000.Dialogue: Jews don't have hell. We have acid reflux.

00:04:38:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:38:140000.Dialogue: Do you want the last dumpling, Sheldon?

00:04:41:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:41:090000.Dialogue: Certainly. It's not like I have to moderate my food intake because I'm planning on eating again very shortly. Mm, mm, mm!

00:04:53:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:53:090000.Dialogue: So, you guys want to do something tonight?

00:04:56:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:56:030000.Dialogue: Nah, I can't. I got to pick up my mom from her water aerobics class. 18 overweight women flapping their arm fat in a swimming pool.

00:05:07:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:07:190000.Dialogue: Looks like the manatee tank at Sea World.

00:05:14:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:14:150000.Dialogue: Oh, there it is: now that you don't have a girlfriend, you want to hang out with me again.

00:05:19:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:19:090000.Dialogue: I never stopped hanging out with you. Oh, please,

00:05:21:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:21:210000.Dialogue: we all know I'm the friend you call when you have no other options. If we were the Justice League, I'd be Aquaman.

00:05:28:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:28:170000.Dialogue: I wish you were Aquaman. Then I could send you to scoop my mom out of the old lady tank.

00:05:35:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:35:120000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm thirsty, so I'm going to go to the refrigerator and get myself a refreshing beverage.

00:05:43:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:43:140000.Dialogue: You know what? I'll just spend the evening alone.

00:05:47:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:47:020000.Dialogue: What, suddenly I'm not good enough for you?

00:05:56:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:56:180000.Dialogue: Ah... I do so love beverages. Now I think I'll take my after-dinner walk.

00:06:08:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:08:130000.Dialogue: Since when do you take after-dinner walks?

00:06:11:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:11:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, since when do you take walks?

00:06:13:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:13:050000.Dialogue: I read a study online that walking after a meal not only aids in digestion, but increases serotonin, and you know me, if there's one thing I like more than a refreshing beverage, it's serotonin. Bye-bye.

00:06:24:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:24:080000.Dialogue: Hold on. I'll walk down with you.

00:06:26:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:26:150000.Dialogue: Oh... that's not necessary. You can go first.

00:06:33:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:33:060000.Dialogue: I can't think of a reason why not.

00:06:55:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:55:020000.Dialogue: All right, say hello to your mother for me.

00:07:05:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:05:220000.Dialogue: You said you were going for a walk.

00:07:11:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:11:090000.Dialogue: So what, you're just gonna walk up and down the stairs?

00:07:18:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:18:020000.Dialogue: That would be odd and suspicious behavior.

00:07:23:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:23:230000.Dialogue: Which way are you going? Which way are you going? I parked my scooter down the block.

00:07:29:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:29:100000.Dialogue: I'm going the other way. Bye.

00:07:40:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:40:010000.Dialogue: No. I mean, I have no idea what you smell.

00:07:43:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:43:190000.Dialogue: I definitely smell raw hot dog.

00:07:46:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:46:210000.Dialogue: Perhaps you're getting a brain tumor.

00:07:49:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:49:130000.Dialogue: All right, have a nice walk.

00:07:51:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:150000.Dialogue: I shall. Have a nice scoot.

00:07:56:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:56:040000.Dialogue: You might want to stand back. I'm sitting on top of 13 horses here.

00:08:12:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:12:040000.Dialogue: Oh. Hello, doggie. Nice doggie. I bet you think you smell hot dogs.

00:08:43:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:43:110000.Dialogue: I had to trade the others for my life.

00:08:55:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:55:020000.Dialogue: I haven't had sex in a year.

00:09:00:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:00:020000.Dialogue: Where you going with this, Raj?

00:09:07:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:07:090000.Dialogue: I want to go out and meet a woman.

00:09:14:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:14:020000.Dialogue: And you think my presence will help with that?

00:09:17:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:17:140000.Dialogue: Well, I do. Next to you, I'll look like a catch.

00:09:21:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:21:140000.Dialogue: I'm not going out tonight, Raj.

00:09:24:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:24:040000.Dialogue: All right. Would you mind if I went to your room and downloaded some Asian pornography?

00:09:36:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:36:220000.Dialogue: Don't worry. You'll meet a girl someday.

00:09:46:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:200000.Dialogue: I do, and you'll fall hopelessly in love and give her your heart. And she'll take it and grind it into pathetic, little pieces.

00:09:55:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:55:200000.Dialogue: But we'll have sex first, right?

00:10:13:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:13:220000.Dialogue: So, um, was Leonard okay with you coming over?

00:10:17:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:17:150000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. In fact, he said, "I'm fine. I don't care." And he in no way said it in a manner which would lead one to believe that he was covering up feelings of anguish and betrayal.

00:10:36:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:36:050000.Dialogue: Oh, I believe that was something else I wasn't supposed to mention.

00:10:43:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:43:020000.Dialogue: Do you have a stomachache, too?

00:10:49:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:49:170000.Dialogue: Why did you ask if I had one, too?

00:10:56:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:56:190000.Dialogue: All right. So, what's new in your life?

00:11:02:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:02:050000.Dialogue: Well, my new shoes are not made for running.

00:11:15:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:15:010000.Dialogue: It's just a suspicion I have.

00:11:22:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:22:040000.Dialogue: I'm so glad you like it.

00:11:26:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:26:180000.Dialogue: Well, maybe that's 'cause Leonard can't cook.

00:11:29:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:29:040000.Dialogue: You can't cook and you made me this.

00:11:33:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:33:030000.Dialogue: Whatever. Ooh, I'm gonna get the cheesecake out of the fridge.

00:11:37:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:37:190000.Dialogue: Oh, Lord, I'm in Jewish hell.

00:11:46:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:46:150000.Dialogue: Look at this. Do you think she's really doing that or is it PhotoShop?

00:11:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:200000.Dialogue: I'm pretty sure Martha Stewart never got naked with a room full of big, fat Japanese guys.

00:12:00:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:00:080000.Dialogue: You don't know that. Prison changes people.

00:12:12:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:12:050000.Dialogue: For an hour and a half?

00:12:16:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:16:210000.Dialogue: How could you get lost? Your phone has GPS.

00:12:23:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:23:020000.Dialogue: There are no solar flares right now.

00:12:25:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:25:170000.Dialogue: Dude, I'm an astrophysicist. If there were solar flares, I'd be all up in it.

00:12:31:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:31:190000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I misspoke. What I meant to say was my battery died.

00:12:39:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:39:010000.Dialogue: What the hell was that about?

00:12:40:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:40:150000.Dialogue: I don't know. Do you think this is really Hillary Clinton doing it with Oprah?

00:12:47:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:47:060000.Dialogue: Oh, we really need to get you a girl.

00:13:01:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:01:110000.Dialogue: Thanks for seeing me on such short notice.

00:13:09:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:09:190000.Dialogue: Maybe this isn't a good time.

00:13:12:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:12:110000.Dialogue: Tell me why you woke me up or I swear to God I will kill you.

00:13:16:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:16:070000.Dialogue: Do you really think death threats are an appropriate way to begin this conversation? Sometimes your lack of social skills astonishes me.

00:13:29:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:29:070000.Dialogue: You may want to sit down.

00:13:34:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:34:070000.Dialogue: Point taken. You may want to sit up.

00:13:41:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:41:100000.Dialogue: I've been seeing Penny behind your back.

00:13:51:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:51:150000.Dialogue: Okay... When you say "seeing Penny, " what exactly does that mean?

00:13:59:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:59:110000.Dialogue: We had dinner last night. She made me spaghetti with little hot dogs cut up in it. Well, little hot dog. I gave up the other five hot dogs to a real dog. A real, big dog.

00:14:11:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:11:200000.Dialogue: A hell hound. Tangential to the primary story. How about I circle back to it?

00:14:17:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:17:160000.Dialogue: Fine. Why did you have dinner with Penny?

00:14:21:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:21:170000.Dialogue: I told you, she made spaghetti with little hot dogs. I like spaghetti with little hot dogs.

00:14:26:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:26:040000.Dialogue: Then why did you have Chinese food with us?

00:14:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:29:090000.Dialogue: I didn't want to upset you. Howard made it very clear that my allegiance should be to male comrades before women who sell their bodies for money.

00:14:40:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:40:040000.Dialogue: Is it possible he said, "Bros before hos"?

00:14:45:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:45:070000.Dialogue: Yes, but I rephrased it to avoid offending the hos.

00:14:50:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:50:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I don't care if you want to be friends with Penny.

00:14:54:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:54:050000.Dialogue: Oh. Well, so the emotional turmoil that's been keeping me from achieving REM sleep was entirely unjustified?

00:15:03:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:03:210000.Dialogue: Well... then as my meemaw would say, "Looks like we butchered a pig, but nobody wanted bacon."

00:15:14:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:14:160000.Dialogue: And now, as promised, the tangent.

00:15:18:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:18:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon and the Hell Hound. Or How I Lost My Hot Dogs.

00:15:28:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:28:040000.Dialogue: Oh, um... I, I can come back.

00:15:31:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:31:060000.Dialogue: D-don't be silly. We're neighbors. We're going to run into each other. May as well get used to it.

00:15:46:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:46:100000.Dialogue: Me neither. Oh, Sheldon seemed tthink that I would be upset about you hanging out with him. But I just want you to know it's fine.

00:15:55:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:100000.Dialogue: Oh, oh, good, because, um, his mother called me.

00:16:01:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:01:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, she wants me to take him shopping for sheets and towels.

00:16:05:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:05:200000.Dialogue: I was going to do that.

00:16:08:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:08:180000.Dialogue: Oh, well, then you... you do it.

00:16:10:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:10:120000.Dialogue: No, I don't want to do it. You can do it.

00:16:12:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:12:150000.Dialogue: Okay, you can take him for shoes.

00:16:14:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:14:220000.Dialogue: I just took him for shoes.

00:16:16:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:16:230000.Dialogue: Well, all I know is he says they hurt his feet.

00:16:22:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:22:040000.Dialogue: Fine. I'll take him for shoes next Saturday.

00:16:25:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:25:200000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, no- a bunch of us from work are going to Disneyland next Saturday and Sheldon wants to come.

00:16:33:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:33:100000.Dialogue: Well, he heard me making plans on the phone. Was I going to say "no"?

00:16:38:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:38:200000.Dialogue: All right. But let me know if you're going to stuff him with junk food. I don't want to bring home a nice dinner for him and see it go to waste.

00:16:48:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:48:020000.Dialogue: We're going to Disneyland. He's going to eat junk food.

00:16:51:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:51:010000.Dialogue: All I'm saying is give me a heads-up.

00:16:57:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:57:140000.Dialogue: And don't let him go on Space Mountain after he eats. He'll say he can handle it, but I promise you'll end up with churro puke on your shoes.

00:17:03:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:03:230000.Dialogue: All right, got it. Is there anything else?

00:17:06:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:06:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, don't let Goofy near him. He'll have nightmares and I'll have to deal with it.

00:17:12:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:12:180000.Dialogue: Wish I knew. He's fine with Pluto.

00:17:21:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:21:160000.Dialogue: Hey, do you think the elastic woman in The Incredibles needs to use birth control or can she just be a diaphra?

00:17:30:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:30:170000.Dialogue: Well, that's it. We're officially out of things to talk about.

00:17:40:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:40:010000.Dialogue: We stayed for the California Adventure water show. It was pure Disney magic.

00:17:47:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:47:030000.Dialogue: I was going to see that with him.

00:17:48:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:48:170000.Dialogue: How was I supposed to know that?

00:17:50:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:50:070000.Dialogue: It's all right. I'll see it again with you.

00:17:52:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:52:150000.Dialogue: And I have food here. You said you were ing to call.

00:17:57:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:57:030000.Dialogue: No, you already threw up once. Go put on your PJs and brush your teeth.

00:18:09:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:09:140000.Dialogue: Aren't you going to thank Penny for taki you to Disneyland?

00:18:19:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:19:090000.Dialogue: Oh, um, I should probably get going.

00:18:22:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:22:170000.Dialogue: Come on. It's just a cup of coffee.

00:18:33:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:33:120000.Dialogue: Uh, yeah, the whole thing seems a little twisted to me, too.

00:18:58:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:58:170000.Dialogue: He's such an angel when he's asleep.

00:19:01:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:01:090000.Dialogue: Yeah. Shame he has to wake up.

00:19:08:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:08:030000.Dialogue: I think we can do it.

00:19:09:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:09:230000.Dialogue: Smother Sheldon in his sleep? Wouldn't that be wrong?

00:19:15:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:15:060000.Dialogue: No, be friends. You and me.

00:19:27:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:27:010000.Dialogue: Here's aidea. I'm just throwing it out tre: friends who have sex.

00:19:35:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:35:120000.Dialogue: Kidding. Just a couple of friends goofin' around.
